image: Identify the main claim or argument in the text.
Identify any evidence provided to support the claim.
Look for words or phrases that imply something without explicit evidence.
Check the accuracy of any factual claims in the text.
Identify and describe any biases present in the text, such as confirmation bias or cherry-picking data.
Detect and describe any logical fallacies, such as strawman arguments or false dichotomies.
Provide examples and evidence for each of the above points.
Calculate an overall score or percentage to quantify the level of bias, based on prior analysis
